Marques,

Have you worked your way through the JUnit FAQ?

It's available o=
nline for reading and (if my memory serves me correctly) it
would have been=
 sent to you when you subscribed to this list.

http://junit.sourceforge.ne=
t/doc/faq/faq.htm

This is only intended to help beginners, so it doesn't c=
over everything,
but it should be a good start.

After that, there are a nu=
mber of JUnit books available on the market.

Some example code is always g=
ood and there are often unit tests in
open-source Java projects that you ca=
n review. I have a couple of JUnit
example projects up on Github that you m=
ay care to look at. They were
specifically written to help people with lear=
ning JUnit so they have extra
comments for the tests.

https://github.com/s=
imonpeter/Fraction
https://github.com/simonpeter/BinaryDigit

Hope this hel=
ps.

Simon
(One of the JUnit list moderators)
